infos.value: ...What's going on? What are you doing over there?
You see something interesting?
...Yeah, I'd say this is quite the sight.
Oh, what shall we do? The thought alone is thrilling, aye?
Whatever's over there couldn't possibly be that interesting.
...It's Oelde's lot.
What!?
...You don't say. They must be traversing the road below this cliff.
What's more, the old lion looks like he's hurting, aye!
I'm not privy to the finer details, but...
I'm told they've fled from Wezette in the direction of Leonis Castle.
What should we do?
Hey, now, what is this? Do they frighten you so?
More like he's in need of a fresh pair of trousers, aye?
That's right, I am afraid. So afraid that I can hardly stand it. Harharhar!
...You don't look that afraid to me.
Oops. Seems I've forgotten to mention.
Zazan is immortal, you see.
Immortal? What fairy tale is this?
Even after taking a fatal blow, he starts breathing easy again soon enough.
Then shouldn't you have no reason to fear death?
You only say that because you've never stared Death in the eye.
Listen.
When you've taken as many deathblows as I have, you get to know Death in that pitch-black sea.
It's more frigid than ice and burns hotter than flame.
It's the kind of thing that would make anyone desperate to escape.
So...that's why you always come back, aye?
I've already been too close to crossing over once and for all. I know Death will catch me one day.
That's why I'm terrified of dying... You understand?
Kind of... Not really, but sure?
You're an odd one, aye?
Harharhar! Speak for yourself.
Either way, I love squashing the life out of others.
...Lovely. Now can we get back to discussing what to do with those Leonis troops?
Th-that was close!
Who did that? I'll give you what for, aye!
I don't think they were aiming for us.
Meaning...it was a warning shot.
Seems that someone is guarding over Oelde, and we surveying the scene has made us their target.
...What should we do? Shall we try for Oelde's head regardless?
No chance. We should turn a blind eye this time.
We have more pressing matters—ones that don't involve him, aye!
What's the matter, Lord Mont?
I feel the presence of bloodlust...
...It wouldn't be strange if someone—or something—was lurking about nearby.
Let us proceed with caution.
Right.
